etymologies: early 20th century: from Greek atopia ‘unusualness’, from atopos ‘unusual’, from a- ‘without’ + topos ‘place’

definitions: denoting a form of allergy in which a hypersensitivity reaction such as dermatitis or asthma may occur in a part of the body not in contact with the allergen.
shortDefinitions: denoting form of allergy in which hypersensitivity reaction such as eczema or asthma may occur in part of body not in contact with allergen
